description: Demolition of the existing garages, and erection of a two storey building comprising two flats including associated cycle storage, landscaping, refuse and recycling storage.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (337-P08-00 (Location Plan), 337-P08-01 (Existing Block Plan), 337-P08-02 (Existing Ground Floor Plan), 337-P08-03 (Existing Elevations/Sections E1/S1), 337-P08-04 (Existing Elevations/Sections E2/S2), 337-P08-05 (Existing Elevations E3/E4), Contaminated Land Screening, Daylight and Sunlight Report, Energy and Sustainability Statement, London Development Database Monitoring Information, Planning Statement, Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment, Statement of Community Involvement, Sustainable Drainage System Assessment Report, Transport Statement and Design and Access Statement- received 14/07/2021
337-P08-06 B (Proposed Block Plan), 337-P08-08 (Proposed First Floor Plan) and 337-P08-09 B (Proposed Roof Plan)- received 9/11/2021 
337-P08-10 C (Proposed Elevations/Sections E1/S1), 337-P08-11 C (Proposed Elevations/Sections E2/S2), 337-P08-12 C (Proposed Elevations E3/E4), 337-P08-13 C (Proposed Elevation E5) and Addendum to Design & Access Statement - received 9/12/2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of secure cycle storage arrangements in accordance with both the London Plan and adopted Local Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The cycle parking shall conform to the West London Cycle Parking Guidance and hard surface paths must be provided to the doors of the cycle stores. The cycle stores shall be made available to occupants upon first occupation of the hereby approved development and maintained as such thereafter without obstruction.
Condition : 6 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Statement received 14/07/2021, and achieve net 'Zero Carbon' emissions.

Condition : 7 - Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers' literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
o	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
o	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
o	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to Oxford Way shall be permanently closed and the kerbs, verge, and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations [and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage hierarchy should make use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and the runoff rate must not exceed 2.5litres/second.  A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 12 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 13 - "Before the development hereby permitted commences:
a.	A contaminated land Phase 1 desk study report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Should the Phase 1 report recommend that a Phase 2 site investigation is required, then this shall be carried out and submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site.  Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary.
b.	If required, a scheme for decontamination of the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval.  The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied.
   During the course of the development:
c.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.  
   Before the development is first brought into use:
d.	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 14 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the walls of any dwelling hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 15 - The development hereby permitted shall obtain a 'Secured by Design' certificate.

Condition : 16 - Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development the waste and recycling stores shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development the boundary treatment as shown on approved drawing number 337-P08-10 received on the 09/12/2021 shall be erected in strict accordance with the approved plans.
